ygData.subject: RE: Bard armor (long boring ego-trip)
ygData.msgSnippet: Faras, Since we are close in levels, let me tell you what I have that is different ... Another option is the Leatherfoot Raiders Cap that gives +10 CHR. ... I
ygData.messageBody:
Faras,

Since we are close in levels, let me tell you what I have that is different
from you:

> Banded Helm - not magic but I would hate to give up the 8AC points for the
> much heavier blackened crown with less AC and the same silly half-elf
> donut-looking graphic that I am tiring of. I heard that Hatar (named low
> 20s sand giant in Oasis) drops a Fine Silk Turban with 10AC .1 weight and
> +10 fire resist that does not have a texturemap on my character, which
> would
> be cool if it is so, but I have never seen one to verify. I would love a
> crested helm for the looks and bonuses but I don't know where to find it
> or
> how much they are
>
Another option is the Leatherfoot Raiders Cap that gives +10 CHR.

> Banded Mask - Dying to get the Guise of the deceiver, guess I should go to
> a
> bazaar and hope for the best - can't go to lower guk yet at 24th
>
I think the Guise is NO DROP. I'm looking forward to this one also.

> Banded Tunic - Once again the AC can't be beat for a reasonable price
> unless
> I go to a medium bronze breastplate, and then the AC vs weight ratio seems
> not worth the upgrade - steel is way out of my price range and obtaining
> better items at my level is seemingly impossible unless I buy them - I am
> not keen on the bloodstained tunic because again, same graphic as banded
> with a reddish tint and less AC with magic bonuses that I am not all that
> interested in as a bard - really want some kind of breastplate for a more
> refined and respectable look.
>
I wear small bronze because I can afford the weight.

> Banded Bracers - Nice AC to weight ratio, not sure what would be better
> for
> me at this time
>
An option is to find a tank friend and go to the Ocean of Tears to
get a Bracer of Erollisi. A 28 monk helped me and we easily defeated the 2
NPCs you have to fight to get the bracer. I heard you have to kill the DE
first before the pirate captain. You then have to loot the DE first before
looting the pirate captain in order for their to be a chance to loot the
bracer. Don't know if this is true or a rumor. The bracer gives +5 STR.
Not certain what the AC is though.

> Blackened Leggings - purely vanity, love the look of the black banded
> pants
> on my half-elf, even though they are heavier and 1 AC less than Banded,
> only
> thing I would trade them in on now would be Barbed Legplates if I could
> find
> them because they are lighter, same AC as banded, and have AGI bonuses
>
I wear bronze because I can afford the weight.

> Banded boots - just waiting for a chance to get some Dwarven work boots
>
Same here

> I have 2 Opalline earrings that I am proud to wear because I killed the
> mob
> and looted them myself, a +5AGI ring and a +2INT ring (with base INT it
> takes me forever to increase my skills)
>
I have 2 Jagged bands which really help me out with the heavier
armor. They also increase AC. I would place these high on your priority
list.

I got the 2 Jagged bands, DE hide gloves, and a trollhide belt for
completing the Glowing Stein quest twice. The first stein I traded for the
2 Jagged Bands. The second time I traded the four ingredients for the DE
hide gloves and trollhide belt. If you do this quest look me up and I can
hook you up with someone who can trade you some good items for them. If you
need help with the stein quest, send me a private email.

Galtin of E'ci
